summary: The Federal Reserve Board Abolition Act aims to abolish the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System and all Federal reserve banks.  It mandates the liquidation of assets, transfer of net proceeds to the Treasury, and assumption of liabilities by the Secretary of the Treasury. The bill includes provisions for managing the dissolution process, addressing employee compensation and benefits, and requires a joint report from the Secretary of the Treasury and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget detailing implementation efforts.
